intro: Cortia oreomyrrhiformis, commonly known as the sweet myrrh. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its aromatic resinous sap. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The resin produced by Cortia oreomyrrhiformis is used in traditional medicine and for its aromatic properties.
